document_type: Operative Report - Cardiac Catheterization and PCI
post_operative_diagnosis: 100% occlusion of distal left circumflex artery
75% stenosis of mid right coronary artery
Status post successful PCI with drug-eluting stents
procedures_performed: Percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) to left circumflex obtuse marginal branch
Percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) to right coronary artery
indications: 77-year-old male with acute onset chest pain, ECG changes showing ST depression in inferior and lateral leads, and elevated cardiac biomarkers (troponin 2.5 ng/mL) consistent with NSTEMI. Patient required urgent cardiac catheterization for diagnosis and potential revascularization.

procedure_description.access: Right femoral artery accessed using modified Seldinger technique. 6 French arterial sheath placed without complication.

coronary_angiography.LAD: Mild disease proximally at 10%, diffuse disease upwards of 40% in mid vessel
coronary_angiography.left_circumflex: Mild disease upwards of 30%, 100% occlusion in distal vessel supplying obtuse marginal branch
coronary_angiography.RCA: Mild disease proximally of 30%, significant tortuosity with stenosis upwards of 75% in mid vessel

PCI_obtuse_marginal.pre_dilation: Emerged 2.0 x 12 mm balloon at 12 ATM
PCI_obtuse_marginal.stent: Onyx 2.0 x 18 mm drug-eluting stent deployed at 14 ATM
PCI_obtuse_marginal.final_result: TIMI 3 flow, no residual stenosis, no dissection

PCI_RCA.lesion: 75% stenosis of mid RCA with significant vessel tortuosity and calcification
PCI_RCA.wire: 0.014 inch guidewire successfully navigated through tortuous RCA
PCI_RCA.pre_dilation: Emerge 3.0 x 15 mm balloon at 12 ATM
PCI_RCA.stent: Onyx 3.0 x 22 mm drug-eluting stent deployed at 16 ATM
PCI_RCA.final_result: TIMI 3 flow, <10% residual stenosis, no complications

procedure_description.hemostasis: Manual compression applied to right femoral artery for 20 minutes. Adequate hemostasis achieved. Distal pulses palpable.

condition: Patient tolerated procedure well. Transferred to cardiac care unit in stable condition. No immediate post-procedure complications. Groin site stable without hematoma or bleeding.
post_op_plan: Admit to cardiac care unit for overnight monitoring
Discharge planning with cardiac rehabilitation referral
